name: Cook the Book: Asian Lamb Chops
description: Like a lot of people my age, the Silver Palate Cookbook became my go-to cookbook when I first started cooking for friends and girlfriends. In fact, the first brunch I ever cooked for my wife featured two recipes from the...
recipeIngredient: 6 thick shoulder-cut lamb chops, trimmed of excess fat

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pork chops; brown lightly on both sides. Drain chops on paper towels.
Add the onion and garlic; cook, covered, over low heat until tender and lightly colored, about 20 minutes.
Add the soy sauce, chile paste, marmalade, vinegar, and ginger. Simmer for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Return the chops to the skillet, cover and cook over low heat, turning once, until done, about 7 minutes. Serve immediately, spooning the sauce over the chops.
